original_solution_mapping.L1: The total cost of the iPhone will cost Carrie $800 - $240 = $<<800-240=560>>560.
original_solution_mapping.L2: It will take her $560 / $80 = <<560/80=7>>7 weeks to earn enough money.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 889.
    Returns: the number of weeks Carrie has to work to purchase the iPhone.
    """
    # L1
    iphone_cost = 800 # The new iPhone costs $800
    trade_in_value = 240 # She can trade in her Samsung Galaxy for $240
    remaining_cost = iphone_cost - trade_in_value

    # L2
    earnings_per_week = 80 # She can make $80 per week babysitting
    weeks_to_work = remaining_cost / earnings_per_week

    # FA
    answer = weeks_to_work
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The total cost of the iPhone will cost Carrie ${iphone_cost} - ${trade_in_value} = $<<{iphone_cost}-{trade_in_value}={remaining_cost}>>{remaining_cost}.
It will take her ${remaining_cost} / ${earnings_per_week} = <<{remaining_cost}/{earnings_per_week}={weeks_to_work}>>{weeks_to_work} weeks to earn enough money.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: The total cost of the iPhone will cost Carrie $800 - $240 = $<<800-240=1040>>1040.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: It will take her $1040 / $80 = <<1040/80=13>>13 weeks to earn enough money.

explanation: Incorrect operation. The calculation should use '-' but used '+' instead.
